Recap: Harley and Gus unknowingly avoid Sebastian all day. Sebastian on the other hand, knows that Harley is there and prepares a syringe for her. Wallace remains in a coma, but opens his eyes briefly. Gus suggests that he and Harley take the children on the run with them. Mallet calls them from jail and later finds out that someone has posted his bail. Harley finds out that Wallace is an ER doctor at Cedars. Reva realizes that Nate may be lying to her. Sandy tells Reva that he is only interested in the family he has now, and not the past. Tammy and Jonathan confront one another. They both agree that they have strong feelings for one another. Jonathan surmises that perhaps she can be his savior. She tells him that she will always choose Sandy over him as it is a simple choice of good versus evil. Jonathan picks up a girl at Farley's Bar and introduces himself as Sandy. Tammy turns to Sandy for comfort.
Transcript: Sandy: I'll take one of those.
Reva: Hey. What are you doing here?
Sandy: Just checking in with you.
Reva: ( Laughs ) No, you're checking up on me.
Sandy: Well, that too. But I'm just sad because we don't get much time to hang out anymore.
Reva: Well, I saw you at the party, but we didn't talk. You've been so busy at Lewis.
Sandy: Yeah. Working side by side with my pal, Jonathan.
Reva: Yeah, I am amazed he's working. I mean, how is that working out?
Sandy: It's actually working out okay.
Reva: Yeah?
Sandy: He's taking the job seriously.
Reva: I know. I find it hard to believe.
Sandy: You and me both. But don't worry, he hasn't lost his boyish charm. He still makes photocopies of certain body parts, which shall remain nameless...
Reva: ( Laughs )
Sandy: And he puts them in my box. I get a new surprise every morning. It's a whole family affair over there. Except for me, of course.
Reva: You are a part of this family, whether you want us or not.
Sandy: Am I?
Reva: Yes, Sandy, you are.
Sandy: Well, good. Then I can just go ahead and ask it: What the hell's going on with you?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nate: Here's my little thief. I checked my bank account before coming over. Thanks. Cover your tracks?
Jonathan: Oh, yeah. No one at Lewis is going to know I'm ripping them off for you.
Nate: Good boy. You hold on to those security codes and you keep stuffing my account. We're going to smash this family into a million pieces for you.
Jonathan: For me?
Nate: Yeah. It's all for you, son. Payback. Redemption. They hate you. You know that. You suffer a kick in the teeth every day.
Jonathan: My cousin, Tammy. She saw me near the computer. I think she's been following me.
Nate: You've handled her before. Do it again. I mean it. You do something about her, or I will.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: Nurse? Can I see Mr. Wallace's chart?
Nurse: Yeah, it's in the room. At the bottom of the bed.
Harley: Oh, thank you.
Nurse: You can take a peek, but it won't tell you anything about our mystery patient.
Harley: Thanks.
Gus: Well?

Harley: She said it's at the bottom of the bed. No, it's nothing we didn't already know. Maybe when they finish logging his stuff. It just kills me. If we had gotten there ten seconds earlier-- ten seconds-- he could have told us what he already knows.
Gus: Somebody didn't want us to get to him at all.
Harley: Well, no kidding. It's working. He's sure not talking now.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nurse: $100,000. Talk about a good day gone bad.

Sebastian: Nurse? I think those things might belong to me. My name is Sebastian Wallace and that's my brother in there. I mean, I'm sorry, I just got a call and, I mean... I can't believe it. I'm just so glad he's still alive.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: You big dope. What are you doing?
Gus: Old habits die hard. It used to work to get my aggressions out.
Harley: Here, use this. It might sting a little.
Gus: My god.
Harley: I'll get you a doctor.
Gus: I don't need a doctor. I'll get... listen, you stay here with motor mouth, okay? God knows he might start talking or something.
Gus: All right, where's the rest of Wallace's stuff?
Sebastian: No worries, Gus. I'll take care of Mr. Wallace's things.

Harley: I don't know if you can hear me, but if you can, I would sure like you to wake up. I'm Harley. We actually met earlier, right before your... unfortunate accident. I just really... I need you to wake up. I need you to speak. Say something because I miss my kids. I just want to go to sleep with my kids, reading them a bedtime story. I can't do that unless I find out who really killed Phillip Spaulding. I want to go home. Mr. Wallace, please help me go home.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: I'm the one who's supposed to be giving the lectures, not you.
Sandy: I'm not lecturing.
Reva: Uh-huh.
Sandy: I just noticed something going on between you and Josh.
Reva: Josh and I are fine.
Sandy: If you say so. Just trying to keep the family together.
Reva: You know, that's interesting coming from you. You know, so interested in family values and all, but yet you never say one word about the family you were born into.

Sandy: I live in the present, Reva. And I care about the family I've chosen: You, Josh, the rest of the Lewis's, Tammy. That's all I need. And I don't feel that I need to go outside for something else. Do you?
Reva: No. I'm fine. And Josh and I are fine.
Sandy: Reva.
Reva: I'll talk to you later.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: ( Gasps )
Jonathan: Hey, Tammy. What are you doing following me?
Tammy: Funny, this is my Mom's property. You're the one who doesn't belong here.
Jonathan: Word of advice: When you follow someone, don't wear clicky heels.
Tammy: I don't know what you're talking about.
Jonathan: Used to be when I turn around all the time now, I see you. You used to run the other way.
Tammy: What were you doing at the office the other day?
Jonathan: I told you, nothing.
Tammy: Right. Just putting girls' names on your PDA.
Jonathan: Yep.
Tammy: You were taking something from Josh, weren't you?
Jonathan: You know, the other day when we were at towers, Reva told me I don't belong among you civilized folk. Maybe I should get a barn. That's where you guys think I belong, isn't it?
Tammy: Am I supposed to feel sorry for you? What did you take from Lewis Construction?
Jonathan: If you think I...
Tammy: If you're...
Jonathan: What? You'll do what?
Tammy: Just stop whatever you're doing.

Jonathan: If you think I did something, why don't you just turn me in? Josh will believe you over me. Why don't you just tell him? Why are you protecting me? You hate me. Everyone hates me. Wouldn't it make you feel better to watch me burn?
Tammy: No. You burned once when you saved me from that fire.
Jonathan: ( Laughs ) So now you want to... you want to return the favor? Is that it? You want to save me? Because you could. I really think you could save me.
Jonathan: You're not running away.
Tammy: No. That's what you do.
Jonathan: What if I told you I was ready to stop running?
Tammy: I don't know. What are you doing?
Jonathan: Why do you protect me? Why do you even care about me at all?
Tammy: I'm just trying to prove to myself that you have no control over me. What you did to me...
Jonathan: This isn't about what I did to you.
Tammy: What you did to me is holding me back from being with Sandy. I can't move forward with him until I put what you did to me in the past.
Jonathan: What I did to you isn't holding you back.
Tammy: Yes, it is. Every time I get close...
Jonathan: I get in the way. It's not about what I did to you. It's about me. I'm holding you back from being with Sandy.
Tammy: No.
Jonathan: It's about me. It's about who I am. It's about who we are, together. It's about how you feel when you walk in a room and you see me there. It's about what you feel right now.
Tammy: Please stop.
Jonathan: No, Tammy. You can lie to yourself and you can lie to Sandy, but I see it, Tammy. I feel it, too.
Tammy: Yes.
Jonathan: What?
Tammy: Yes. It doesn't make any sense to me, feeling like this, and I hate myself for it, but yes. I do. I feel it, too.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Ow. Hi. ( Laughs ) Stop it. What has you so happy?
Nate: Besides seeing you?
Reva: Yeah, besides seeing me.
Nate: You are looking at a man with a clean bill of health.
Reva: Wonderful.
Nate: Or at least a clean bill from the Health Inspector.
Reva: Your bar passed inspection already? That was so fast.
Nate: Not only that. I have found an investor who loves me so much, they paid my loan for the next three months.
Reva: No.
Nate: Yes.
Reva: That is wonderful. Who do you know? No, you deserve this. You do, because you work very hard to get what you want.
Nate: And usually, Reva, I get it. And you know why, Reva?
Reva: Nate?
Nate: Because I never give up.
Reva: You know what I think? I think that we need to throw a party. You know, a Celebration/Promotional event for this bar.
Nate: Well, you being happy for me is good enough.

Reva: No, no, no, no. It's not good enough. We need to... ( Gasps ) I know. This will be my gift to you. I want to bring your entire family here. All of the Hoffers that exist, bring them all here to Springfield. What do you say?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: Mr. Wallace? Can you hear me? Please hear me. Hello? Mr. Wallace? ( Cell phone rings )
Gus: Who's calling Mallet's phone? Hello?
Mallet: Good. So you're still out there.
Gus: Who is this?
Mallet: Boy, you must have been some kind of detective. Who do you think this is? Whose cell phone do you have and who's the only guy who knows you have it?
Gus: Oh, it's you. How are you?
Mallet: Great, great. I always wanted to see prison from the other side of the bars.
Gus: What do you want? I'm kind of busy.
Mallet: Well, not too busy for this.

Harley: Mr. Wallace? Mr. Wallace, can you hear me? Did you hear me asking you for help? Is that why you opened your eyes? Okay... well blink or you could squeeze my hand. Whatever you need to do, okay? I know that you can help me.
Sebastian: Look at that. This is just too easy.
Harley: Hello?
Mallet: It's good to hear your voice.

Harley: No. No, no. No, no, Mr. Wallace? Mr. Wallace, don't... Mr. Wallace, don't close your eyes. Don't... don't close your eyes, Mr. Wallace. Can you hear me? Okay, I'm going to find a doctor. I'll get a doctor.
Sebastian: Well, well, well. Hey there, buddy. Are you busy?
Gus: Can we hurry this up a little bit? I'm a little pressed for time here, okay?
Mallet: Put her on the line.
Gus: I can't do that right now.
Mallet: Sure you can.
Gus: No, I can't. She's working on something. We're working on a new angle, okay?
Mallet: So what's the plan so far?
Gus: I don't even know if this phone is tapped, someone's listening in. I'm going to hang up now.
Harley: Who are you talking to?
Gus: Careful, it might be tapped.
Harley: Hello?
Mallet: It's good to hear your voice. You sound... free.
Harley: For now.
Mallet: I'd like to see you stay that way.
Harley: How are you?
Mallet: Oh, you know. I'm a little locked up.
Harley: I'm so sorry.
Mallet: It's for a good cause.
Harley: Why are you calling?
Mallet: I just wanted to say that... the cell phone is prepaid, so you've got plenty of minutes, okay? You don't have to worry about it getting shut down or anything like that.
Harley: Thank you.
Mallet: You still there?
Harley: Yeah. We're following a lead. I mean, it's a little iffy, but it's something.

Mallet: Hey, when this is over and you're back home and I'm on the outside, I don't know, maybe one of those days, after you send your boys off to school, maybe you could meet me for a cup of coffee or something?
Harley: I'd like that. I mean it.
Mallet: Take care of yourself.
Harley: You, too. I mean that, too.
Mallet: I know.
Gus: It's hard to run away from the past, huh?
Harley: We have to get a doctor or someone. Wallace opened his eyes.
Gus: He did? Well, did he say anything?
Harley: No, but I think he's waking up.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Nate: Reva, look, I appreciate you wanting to throw a party for me and wanting to bring my family over the pond and all, but the truth is I hardly have any family left. And the family that I do have, they don't really like me.
Reva: Come on. There has to be someone. A cousin, an aunt, an uncle.
Nate: Look, I've been on my own so long, I wouldn't even know where to start to look for family.
Reva: Well, I know. You call information or you get a phone book. Just find out where all the Hoffers live, you know? What's that number that you always call first? It's "011," is that it, for...
Nate: Reva, stop.
Reva: Well, no. I mean, family is important. You've got to bury the hatchet at some point.
Nate: I said... I said no.
Reva: What's wrong?
Nate: I have what I want in my life. This bar, a chance.
Reva: Well, I just... I thought that maybe...
Nate: Look, my family look down on me. They always have. And seeing me and this place, that wouldn't help.
Reva: Okay. Okay. I'm sorry.
Nate: Thank you for understanding.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Can you feel that?
Tammy: Yes.
Jonathan: I don't even have to say what that is and you know what I'm talking about.
Tammy: I try to ignore it. I try to feel nothing but hate for you because I hate myself if I don't. I hate myself for wanting to do anything but put a knife in your face for what you did to me.
Jonathan: I'll give you the knife.
Tammy: You wanted to hurt me. You took something away from me that I can never get back.
Jonathan: Tammy, I'm...

Tammy: No. I don't want to hear that you're sorry. That is not what I need. When you seduced me, when you touched me, I thought I saw in your eyes what I'm seeing right now. I was wrong then. And stupid, needy. I thought if I denied this for long enough, if I just pushed it down, it would go away, but it didn't.
Jonathan: Because it couldn't.
Tammy: Why? Why the hell not?

Jonathan: I don't know. I don't know. I tried to get rid of you, too. You think I want that? I don't know. Reva, like, tries to change me, make me whole, I don't know. She tries to make me a different person. But I mean, as much as Reva gets to me, nobody affects me the way that you do. When I'm around you, I want to be...
Tammy: Be what?
Jonathan: Anything different. Anything but what I am. You make me want to be that.
Tammy: To be someone else?

Jonathan: Anyone else. I mean, even when I'm at my angriest and my desire to hurt someone, hurt anyone, even my desire to hurt myself is at its greatest, I feel like if someone like you, someone pure and beautiful and innocent, if you could love...
Tammy: Stop. Don't say it. Don't say it!
Jonathan: Tammy. Tammy, Tammy, if we weren't who we are, if I hadn't hurt you...
Tammy: Stop.
Jonathan: Tammy, please. You could save me. You could save me.
Tammy: No. Even if we weren't cousins, even if we weren't who we are, I would still choose Sandy. Because I have to. I would still reject you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gus: So, when this happens to a person, how long does it take them to wake up again?
Harley: Because I was... I was talking to him. I asked him to open his eyes and then he did.
Nurse: I'll check on him.
Gus: Thanks.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Little boy: ( Sobbing )
Sebastian: How is he?
Nurse: Mr. Wallace, you startled me.
Sebastian: Sorry.
Nurse: How can I help you?

Sebastian: Well, I'm just... I'm worried sick about him, and I know it's probably against policy, I don't know, but do you mind if I just sit here with him for a while? Just for a while? Please? Thank you. Thanks.
Little boy: ( Sobs )
Harley: Zach? What are you doing out here all by yourself? Are you lost?
Little boy: I wanted to get Mommy a cookie from the machine.
Harley: To make her feel better? Is she sick?
Little boy: I miss her. I wish she was home.
Harley: I know that Mommy misses you too, sweetie.
Nurse: His vitals are stable but there's really no change in his condition.
Gus: Right.
Harley: But I saw him open his eyes.
Nurse: There's no sign of him coming out of that coma any time soon.
Gus: All right, well, thank you. If something changes, can you let us know? Thanks.
Harley: What is that? Strike two? Three?
Gus: 11? I don't know.
Harley: Well, why don't we stop worrying about that and try to help somebody. Why don't we go find that machine, buy the cookie and then go find mommy. What do you say? Good.
Gus: Sounds great to me. I think I just came up with a little plan.
Harley: Talk.
Gus: When we get home.
Harley: Home. Yeah.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Tammy.
Tammy: I am not your savior, Jonathan.
Jonathan: I think you could be.
Tammy: No. The reason I can't be with you is not because you're my half-cousin or because you stole my virginity and tossed it in the shredder. It's because of who you are.
Jonathan: Who I am?
Tammy: As a person. As a human being. Even if I wanted to be... you are not whole, Jonathan.
Jonathan: You think so, huh?
Tammy: There are flashes, moments when you're decent, but those moments are surrounded by so much ugliness. Too much ugliness for me.
Jonathan: Yeah. Not like Sandy, huh?
Tammy: I do need Sandy. Sandy who makes me feel loved and good and valued. He makes me feel clean. That's one of the reasons I love him so much. I love that he makes me feel good about myself.
Jonathan: I'll make you feel, too. You can't deny that.
Tammy: No, I can't. I feel a lot when I'm with you. You make me feel dirty and wrong and stupid. I don't want to be the kind of person that I feel like I am when I'm with...
Jonathan: Shut up. You've said enough.
Tammy: ( Sobs )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nate: I've never met anyone like you.
Reva: Really? I get that a lot.
Nate: There's something for everybody.
Reva: ( Laughs )
Nate: Mother hen, raging party girl, tough broad. Sexy whether you want to be or not.
Reva: You make me sound schizoid. Not that I don't feel that already. I mean, the web site said that I was to expect that, but...
Nate: What web site?
Reva: Never mind.
Nate: Look, I wanted you to know that I appreciate everything you're trying to do for me. I appreciate you in so many ways.
Reva: You know that a friend told me, very recently, that I needed to appreciate what I have and not go looking for something else somewhere else.
Nate: Is that what you're doing?
Reva: I don't know.
Nate: Look, Reva, I know that family is important to you. So if being here, spending time with me, is going to jeopardize your other life... is it worth it?
Reva: I think it is.
Nate: Well, I'm flattered, because the feeling is mutual. And I think you can handle this double life.
Reva: We'll see.
Nate: Would you care to see right now?
Reva: What do you mean?
Nate: Come to my hotel room. I will make it worth your while.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Sandy: Hey.
Tammy: ( Sobbing ) Sandy.
Sandy: What happened?
Tammy: It doesn't matter.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Hey. What to hear my best pick-up line? You just heard it. They did a study that says that "Hello" is the best thing a guy can say to pick up a girl. Want to hear another one?
Zoë: What is it?
Jonathan: Did it hurt when you fell from heaven?
Zoë: I think you can do better than that.
Jonathan: "All, everything that I understand, I understand because of love." Tolstoy.
Zoë: Whatever. I'm sold.
Jonathan: ( Laughs )
[SCENE_BREAK]

Sebastian: What does Alan want with you? I mean, he cuts you 100 g's and he wants you dead? Huh. Not on my watch, good buddy. No way. Not yet. Not until I find out your secret. Something's going on with Gus and Alan and Harley, the Holy Trinity of Springfield. The missing piece of the puzzle. And I'm going to find out what it is, so I'd really like you to start talking to me, Mr. Wallace, and tell me what you know. Get it off your chest. Come on, now. I'm all ears.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: Okay, well, we are home, I guess.
Gus: Now, you just sit right here. This is our little house, okay?
Harley: Let's talk.
Gus: We'll do this the way I think it should be done.
Harley: What's the plan?
Gus: I've seen it like this on television. ( Knocks on door ) Lover! I'm home. Is there anything to eat?
Harley: What are you doing?
Gus: Well, I saw you with the little kid and I took it as a sign.
Harley: A sign of what?
Gus: A sign that all of this could be real.
Harley: All what? Like a soap opera?
Gus: No, no, not a soap opera. A life. A house. A family. We've got to come to terms with the fact that Wallace might not make it. He might not come out of that coma. We can't stay in New York.
Harley: Because the Feds know we're here.
Gus: Yes. So let them. Let them think we're here. Sprinkle some seeds, keep them here. We run back to Springfield, we grab the kids.
Harley: Grab the kids?
Gus: Yes, we grab the kids.
Harley: And do what? What, are we going to run?
Gus: Honey.
Harley: For how long, Gus? Forever?
Gus: It's a very big country. It's a beautiful country out there. We go out there, we find a place for us, something specialized, a small town.
Harley: Like where?

Gus: Does it matter where? Could be anywhere? Arizona. Montana. British Columbia. We keep our heads down and we change our names and we get to have our family. Babe, we lost each other there for a little while, you know? Please let's not risk doing that again.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Sandy: Just tell me what happened.
Tammy: I'm fine now.
Sandy: Now?
Tammy: I'm fine.
Sandy: Okay.
Tammy: Can you just hold me?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Okay, so I'm not saying this as a come-on or anything, but after years and years of therapy and testing, I'm really trying to figure out whether or not I'm allergic to sex. ( Laughter )
Zoë: Thanks for cheering me up.
Jonathan: Baby, we can do a lot more than that if you want.
Zoë: It'd be nice to know your name first.
Jonathan: Well, howdy. Sandy's my name. The name is Sandy.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: I... can't.
Nate: No? You can't, not now. Maybe later?

Reva: You know what? You need to leave and go do your books or something or, you know, make this place look good for your new investor. I mean, I'm really happy that you have this cash flow coming in now. By the way, do I happen to know who it is?
Nate: It's a silent deal. They want to stay off the town radar.

Reva: Yes, hi. I want to have a gift sent to the room of one of your guests, please. Nate Hoffer. A gift basket, something, you know, wonderfully fun. Wicked. ( Laughs ) no, I'm sure I have the name right. You know what? Why don't you try... it could be Nathaniel or Nathan Hoffer? Well, no. Either you have the name wrong or... or Nate's lying to me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: I'm off the phone, if you want to take me back.
Guard: You might not be there long. Someone called about posting your bail.
Mallet: ( Laughs ) That's great news. For some people. Bad news for other people.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: So, what? We just keep running?
Gus: Keep running. It would be like a lifestyle. Like a choice. Like the witness protection program.
Harley: Yeah. Living in fear, always looking over our shoulders.
Gus: Not if we do it smart and we do it right. We get to have our kids and we get to have our family.
Harley: What about catching Phillip's killer?

Gus: Frank would have to keep the case open and maybe we would get lucky in a couple of years, okay? We could come out of the cold. Look, I'll do anything, but I will not stand around when somebody throws you behind bars again. I won't do it.
Harley: Yeah, well, when we get caught, you're going to jail, too.
Gus: That's exactly why we can never get caught.
Harley: My family. I can't.

Gus: Listen, baby, I know. You'll call your family, we'll get in touch with every single one of them. And my family, well, they can go to hell and I'm not going to hell with them, okay? And it's our chance to get a little revenge on Phillip, too, just by being happy. What do you say? What do you say? Take that leap with me.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Sebastian: Well, Mr. Wallace, you have been absolutely no help whatsoever. But you are one hell of a poker player. How many cards do you need? Okey dokey. Oh, look at that. Flush to the king. Good going, buddy. You win again. Just my luck. Well, you know what? I have a very good feeling that my luck is about to change because as soon as Harley comes back, I'm going to lay down a killer hand. And Harley, my friend, she's going to lose, big-time.
Nurse: Yes, you wanted me to call if there was any change in Dr. Wallace's condition.
Harley: I'm sorry, Dr. Wallace?
Nurse: Yes. We finished going through his belongings and found his hospital ID badge. It seems this patient is an ER doc at Cedars Hospital in Springfield.
[SCENE_BREAK]
_Next, on "Guiding Light." _
Coop: Alex, please. All right? One hour, that's all I ask.
Cassie: Do you think I'm here just to get back at Edmund.
Dinah: The baby belongs to the undersigned. Cassie didn't sign it.
Jonathan: You think things are messed up now, babe? You just wait. You want to sit down and tell me how pathetic and disgusting I am, then go right ahead.
Jonathan: Tammy, please. You could save me. You could save me.
Tammy: No.
